name: The Gateway Hotel, Agra

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel needs a major injection of cash. The rooms are scruffy, large cracks in bathroom walls, power sockets that do not work and worsed of all, loads of dead flys between the double glazing, somewhat spoiling your very limited view of the "Wonderful, Taj Mahal." The main restaurant resembles a factory cafeteria, though the French restaurant is very good, with excellent food.
reviews.title: Too many Suits

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, the bigest problem, as the title states, is "Too many Suits". At one time we counted five Suits huddled together in deep conversation (resembling a scene from the Godfather), whilst one chef and two waiters tried to serve 30 covers. Each time a member of staff comes to the room he is shadowed by a Suit, who lerks behind him with a clipboard. The Suits will not converse with guests, they appear way above that. Sad, because this must have been a grand place in it's day.
reviews.title: A good base for Agra and the Taj

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spend some money and get the Suits cleaning to tiolets, would be my advise. That being said, do not let this put you off visiting the Taj, which has a mistique like nothing we have ever experienced. Make sure you have a knowlegable guide, as they is much more to this place than meets the eye.
reviews.title: Not convinced this is a 5 star hotel

reviews.text: We arrived late in the day and found the welcome very warm. We got a comfortable room that is typical of Gateway hotels. Gateways seem to be business hotels well appointed with the necessary amenities. We went for a ho-hum late dinner but had a good rest in preparation for an early morning rise to see the sun rise on the Taj Mahal - magnificent.
reviews.title: Must be the best place to stay in Agra!

reviews.text: Returned for the breakfast buffet and was greeted with a good selection and fine food.
reviews.title: Read before you go

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights in December 2011. Great hotel, very clean and room a reasonable size. The breakfast that was included in the price was lovely. We upgraded to a Taj facing room which was a waste of money while we were there as it was so foggy (or smoggy) that you couldn't see the Tag Mahal at all. Would definitely recommend it as a mid range hotel.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pleasant gardens by swimming pool were a welcome relief in Agra.
reviews.title: Oasis in Agra
splendid!
reviews.text: We checked out at 12 noon but had to hang around until around 8pm waiting for a train. No pressure to leave. They loooked after our bags, assisted with train times and we sat in the garden and had tea in the afternoon and in the reception later.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Servcie in the canteen style restaurant was poor. On the main desk generally very good.
reviews.title: A nice stay

reviews.text: A splendid place to relax and enjoy, location is nice, rooms very clean and beautifully decorated, cleanliness superb, really a spectacular place to spend time and relax in luxury while on a trip
reviews.title: Not at Taj standards

reviews.text: My family stayed here in mid-Dec 2011 for one night. Good price compared to the super luxury in Agra. Staff at reception and in the restaurant were very helpful and nice. Decent sized room, comfortable bed, spartan bathroom, clean everywhere in room and bathroom, and overall--- best combo package for the price and level of service. We had a Taj facing room, but with so much fog/smog in mid-Dec, there wasn't much to see so not sure it's worth paying extra.
reviews.title: good mix of price and service for Agra

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Agra hotels are quite bad in general, so altogether this hotel is OK. Staff is very welcoming, you get all the wet towel, welcome drink and sitting check-in royal treatment. I complained about the connecting room (as you can usually hear the neighbors), and they upgraded us to a nice suite (I guess booking direct to them instead of through an agent helps). Therefore, I surely cannot complain about this hotel!
reviews.title: A bit old, problem is noise, but OK with charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the room, bed and pillows are very good. Room was very charming with antiques. The biggest problem is the noise... Drivers in India like to horn every second, but it seems that they have their pact not to horn from 11 pm. On the other hand, a temple starts playing very loud music at 5 am! The room has triple glazing, well sealed, except for a small window which was built on the cheap, and all the noise comes from there! I really do not understand: Taj could pay US$ 100 per room to have this small window sealed properly, maybe add another layer of glass, and no guest would complain about noise!!!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel and location but could be noisy if you have a front room

reviews.text: In the winter it is foggy and hazy, and the Taj is not illuminated during the night, therefore I see no real point to get a room with a view on the Taj. Garden view is much better, and quieter.
reviews.title: Great view of the Taj! ! !

reviews.text: Buffet is good value, nothing luxurious but they have some really tasty and fresh food. There is no good bar. Pool is very nice, but too cold to use in winter.
reviews.title: Price is Right

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here when we returned to Agra for a second visit. The hotel was excellent. We requested a Taj Mahal facing room and it was certainly great to rise in the morning or walk into the room and see the Taj Mahal looking at us. I loved the Taj Mahal facing room and can thoroughly recommend one. The room was modern and everything worked well in the bathroom. The hotel staff were helpful and polite. Breakfast was good with a great selection of food. We didn't dine in the main dining room but just had something in the informal dining room (can't remember its name). I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Gateway Hotel and would be happy to stay at the hotel again.
reviews.title: An enjoyable stay at the Gateway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the poorest hotel of our recent tour in India, we expected more from the Taj group and the description given. Booked a ‘Superior Room (Taj Mahal View)’ for two nights and were really looking forward to the stay, what a disappointment the entire hotel experience turned out to be, although it is situated near to all of the stunning sights of Agra.
reviews.title: Tired out touring hotel

reviews.text: The lobby area is fine, first we were shown to a smoky room with single beds, then they found us the type of room we had reserved. However, a Taj glimpse at the side of a busy road may be a better description. Nice sized room and excellent shower but this was not the quality anticipated, everything is getting tired and worn out, the towels and bed linen in particular. The bed itself was quite uncomfortable and there was an unusual collection of dead insects in the secondary double-glazing.
reviews.title: A good hotel that you will enjoy for sightseeing in Agra.

reviews.text: Very noisy both sound transfer between rooms and particularly from the street side, definitely consider a garden view and get some peace overnight. Breakfast was OK but I did have to ask for the table to be properly cleaned before we could sit down. The evening meal in GAD was enjoyable, however the speciality restaurant Jhankar was a not worth the visit, very slow service and cold food, the staff were indifferent.
reviews.title: "The Worst of Seven"

reviews.text: A busy touring hotel with high turnover, we did not enjoy the stay.
reviews.title: Does not feel like a Taj - but good sevice

description: ABOUT THE GATEWAY HOTEL FATEHABAD ROAD AGRA: Set amidst six acres of landscaped gardens, The Gateway Hotel Fatehabad Road Agra offers an excellent view of The Taj Mahal from many of its rooms. GETTING THERE & AROUND:• 5 km from the railway station• 10 km from the airport• 3 km from The Taj Mahal. STAY:• 100 rooms including suites• Wi-Fi internet throughout the hotel• Television with cable/satellite channels• Electronic safe. Standard City/Pool View Rooms: Well-appointed rooms. Superior Taj View Rooms: With a mix of contemporary and Mughal design, these rooms offer an excellent view of the Taj Mahal. Executive Taj View Rooms: An elevated sitting area in these rooms on higher floors offers a breath-taking view of the Taj Mahal. Executive Suites: These have a private library, a DVD Player and a spectacular view of the Taj Mahal. HANGOUTGAD - All Day Dining: The all day dining restaurant serves Indian and International cuisine. Jhankar: For traditional Indian cuisine(19:30 till 23:30 hrs only) Saqui: For a fine selection of wines, spirits and cigars.
